title: Architecture
description: Daytona architecture diagram represents the Daytona platform, featuring components and services available in its Open Source and Enterprise distributions.

title: Open Source
description: Daytona Open Source includes the Daytona API, which serves as the central interface for programmatically interacting with Daytona.

title: Interfaces
description: Daytona Open Source offers a variety of Interfaces to interact with the platform and manage development environments.

title: Git Providers
description: Daytona Open Source integrates Git Providers to manage version control operations and interact with Git repositories.

title: Container Registries
description: Container registries store credentials used to pull container images from specified registry servers.

title: Providers
description: Daytona Open Source uses Providers to enable integration with various technologies to create and manage development environments.

title: Targets
description: Targets

title: Enterprise
description: The Enterprise edition of Daytona extends the capabilities of the Open Source version with additional features and services tailored for enterprise-grade development environments.

title: Dashboard
description: The Enterprise version introduces a Dashboard, which provides a centralized interface for managing and monitoring the platform, improving visibility and control over development environments.

title: Authentication
description:
Authentication features support Single Sign-On (SSO) and standards such as Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) and
System for Cross-domain Identity Management (SCIM), ensuring secure access to the platform.

title: Authorization
description: Authorization capabilities allow for granular control of access and permissions across users, teams, organizations, and projects.

title: Observability
description: Observability tools offer enhanced monitoring, logging, and tracing capabilities for Workspaces and development activities.

title: Resource Management
description: Resource Management is expanded with enterprise features, enhancing workspace classes and quota management to meet large-scale, organization-wide requirements.

title: Identity Providers
description: The Enterprise version integrates with Identity Providers (IDP) to enhance authentication and identity management.

title: Security
description: Daytona Enterprise enhances security by integrating with advanced security tools and services.

title: Getting Started
description: Welcome to Daytona!

title: Understanding Daytona
description: Daytona is an open-source Development Environment Manager (DEM) licensed under the Apache License 2.

title: Before You Begin
description: Before installing and using Daytona, ensure that your operating system meets the necessary requirements, dependencies and tools.

title: System requirements
description: Daytona supports multiple operating systems and architectures.

title: Dependencies
description: Daytona requires specific dependencies to be installed on your system to support the operation and management of development environments.

title: Tools
description: Daytona requires certain tools to be installed on your system to optimize the setup and management of development environments.

title: Installing Daytona
description: Follow the instructions provided in the installation guide to install Daytona on your operating system.

title: Using the CLI
description: The Daytona Command-Line Interface (CLI) is the primary method of interacting with the Daytona platform.

title: Adding a Git Provider
description: Integrate Daytona with a Git Provider to manage version control operations and interact with your Git repositories.

title: Installing a Provider
description: Providers

title: Setting a Target
description: A Target refers to the specific destination or environment where your development setups, facilitated by various Providers, are deployed and managed.

title: Choosing the Default IDE
description: Connect to your development environment using a variety of IDEs, including popular options like [Visual Studio Code (VSCode)](/docs/usage/ide

title: Creating your Workspace
description: [Create a Workspace](/docs/usage/workspaces

title: What is Daytona?
description: Daytona is an open-source Development Environment Manager (DEM) licensed under the Apache License 2.

title: Features
description: Daytona creates a secure VPN connection between the client machine and the remote machine.

title: API Keys
description: Daytona API keys are used to authenticate requests to the Daytona API.

title: Generate an API Key
description: Daytona provides an option to generate API keys.

title: List API Keys
description: Daytona provides an option to list all generated API keys.

title: Revoke an API Key
description: Daytona provides an option to revoke API keys.

title: Container Registries
description: Container registries store credentials used to pull container images from specified registry servers.

title: Set a Container Registry
description: Daytona provides an option to set a container registry through environment variables for your Workspace.

title: List Container Registries
description: Daytona provides an option to list the container registries configured for your Workspaces.

title: Delete a Container Registry
description: Daytona provides an option to delete a container registry from your Workspace.

title: Git Providers
description: Git Providers — sometimes known as software forges or Source Code Managers (SCMs) — provide a set of tools to host and collaborate on codebases using Git.

title: Add a Git Provider
description: Daytona provides an option to add a Git Provider, enabling you to connect your preferred Git Provider and access your repositories directly from Daytona.

title: List Connected Git Providers
description: Daytona provides an option to keep track of your Git Providers by listing all previously created Git Providers.

title: Update a Git Provider
description: Daytona provides an option to update an existing Git Provider, enabling you to apply the latest enhancements and bug fixes.

title: Delete a Git Provider
description: Daytona provides an option to delete Git Providers, helping you manage and delete those that are no longer needed.

title: GitHub
description: Daytona provides an option to connect your GitHub account and access your repositories directly from Daytona.

title: GitLab
description: Daytona provides an option to connect your GitLab account and access your repositories directly from Daytona.

title: Bitbucket
description: Daytona provides an option to connect your Bitbucket account and access your repositories directly from Daytona.

title: GitHub Enterprise Server
description: Daytona provides an option to connect your GitHub Enterprise Server account and access your repositories directly from Daytona.

title: GitLab Self-Managed
description: Daytona provides an option to connect your GitLab Self-Managed account and access your repositories directly from Daytona.

title: Bitbucket Server
description: Daytona provides an option to connect your Bitbucket Server account and access your repositories directly from Daytona.

title: Codeberg
description: Daytona provides an option to connect your Codeberg account and access your repositories directly from Daytona.

title: Gitea
description: Daytona provides an option to connect your Gitea account and access your repositories directly from Daytona.

title: Gitness
description: Daytona provides an option to connect your Gitness account and access your repositories directly from Daytona.

title: Azure DevOps
description: Daytona provides an option to connect your Azure DevOps account and access your repositories directly from Daytona.

title: AWS CodeCommit
description: Daytona provides an option to connect your AWS CodeCommit account and access your repositories directly from Daytona.

title: Gogs
description: Daytona provides an option to connect your Gogs account and access your repositories directly from Daytona.

title: Gitee
description: Daytona provides an option to connect your Gitee account and access your repositories directly from Daytona.

title: Providers
description: Providers are plugins through which Daytona integrates with various technologies to create and manage development environments.

title: Install a Provider
description: Daytona provides an option to install a Provider to interface with the Daytona Server.

title: List Providers
description: Daytona provides an option to list all installed Providers, providing you with an overview of the Providers available for managing Workspaces.

title: Update a Provider
description: Daytona provides an option to update an existing Provider, enabling you to apply the latest enhancements and bug fixes.

title: Uninstall a Provider
description: Daytona provides an option to uninstall an existing Provider, helping you manage your Providers by removing those that are no longer needed.

title: Docker
description: The Docker Provider allows Daytona to create Workspace projects as Docker containers.

title: DigitalOcean
description: The DigitalOcean Provider allows Daytona to create Workspace projects on DigitalOcean VMs, known as Droplets.

title: AWS
description: The AWS Provider allows Daytona to create and manage Workspace projects on Amazon EC2 instances.

title: Azure
description: The Azure Provider allows Daytona to create Workspace projects on Azure compute instances.

title: GCP
description: The GCP Provider allows Daytona to create Workspace projects on Google Cloud Platform (GCP) compute instances.

title: Hetzner
description: The Hetzner Provider allows Daytona to create Workspace projects on Hetzner Cloud VMs.

title: Fly
description: The Fly Provider allows Daytona to create Workspace projects on Fly VMs, known as Fly Machines.

title: Server
description: The Daytona Server is a daemon that runs on your machine and handles Workspaces related actions.

title: Start the Server
description: Run the following command to start the Daytona Server:

title: Configure the Server
description: The Daytona Server configuration is located in different directories depending on your operating system.

title: Restart the Server
description: Run the following command to restart the Daytona Server:

title: Stop the Server
description: Run the following command to stop the Daytona Server:

title: Target Configurations
description: A Target Configuration refers to the specific destination or environment where your development setup, facilitated by various Providers, is deployed and managed.

title: Create a Target Configuration
description: Daytona provides an option to create a Target Configuration to use when managing Workspaces.

title: List Target Configurations
description: Daytona provides an option to keep track of your Target Configurations by listing all previously created Target Configurations with their details.

title: Delete a Target Configuration
description: Daytona provides an option to delete Target Configurations, helping you manage and remove those that are no longer needed.

title: Docker (Local)
description: Daytona provides an option to create a local Docker Target Configuration to use for deploying and managing Workspaces.

title: Docker (Remote)
description: Daytona provides an option to create a remote Docker Target Configuration to use for deploying and managing Workspaces.

title: DigitalOcean
description: Daytona provides an option to create a DigitalOcean Target Configuration to use for deploying and managing Workspaces.

title: AWS
description: Daytona provides an option to create an AWS Target Configuration to use for deploying and managing Workspaces.

title: Azure
description: Daytona provides an option to set an Azure Target Configuration to use for deploying and managing Workspaces.

title: GCP
description: Daytona provides an option to create a Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Target Configuration to use for deploying and managing Workspaces.

title: Hetzner
description: Daytona provides an option to create a Hetzner Target Configuration to use for deploying and managing Workspaces.

title: Fly
description: Daytona provides an option to create a Fly Target Configuration to use for deploying and managing Workspaces.

title: Workspace Templates
description: A Workspace Template is designed to simplify the management of development environments, allowing you to predefine settings that can be easily applied to any new Workspace.

title: Create a Workspace Template
description: Daytona provides an option to add a Workspace Template, enabling you to store and reuse Workspace properties across multiple Workspaces.

title: List Workspace Templates
description: Daytona provides an option to list all Workspace Templates, providing you with an overview of the properties stored within each Template.

title: Update Workspace Template
description: Daytona provides an option to update an existing Workspace Template, enabling you to modify the properties stored within it.

title: Delete Workspace Template
description: Daytona provides an option to delete an existing Workspace Template, enabling you to remove properties that are no longer needed.

title: Workspace Template Information
description: Daytona provides an option to view detailed information of a Workspace Template, providing you with an overview of the properties stored within it.

title: Set Default Workspace Template
description: Daytona provides an option to set a default Workspace Template, enabling you to define a Template that will be used by default when creating new Workspaces.

title: Import Workspace Template
description: Daytona provides an option to import a Workspace Template, enabling you to reuse existing Workspace properties across multiple Workspaces.

title: Export Workspace Template
description: Daytona provides an option to export a Workspace Template, enabling you to save the properties of a Workspace Template as a JSON object.

title: Installation
description: Install Daytona on Linux, macOS, and Windows systems.

title: Installation
description: Install Daytona on Linux using the following installation script:

title: ARM64
description: Install Daytona on macOS using the following installation script:

title: Telemetry
description: All telemetry data is **completely anonymous** and **does not** include any personally identifiable information (PII) or user secrets.

title: The Goal
description: The goal of gathering telemetry data in the CLI is exclusively for the purpose of improving the Daytona ecosystem.

title: Gathering Policy
description: Telemetry gathering in the CLI is **opt-out**.

title: CLI Identifier
description: All telemetry events contain a unique identifier.

title: Data Protection
description: We use <a href="https://posthog.

title: Debugging
description: Telemetry events can be debugged by setting `LOG_LEVEL=trace` which will output information about the telemetry event queue.

title: Troubleshooting
description: You can use the following troubleshooting tips to resolve common issues with Daytona.

title: VPNs and Firewalls
description: If your VPN is configured to handle all IP traffic or if your Firewall is configured to block certain IP addresses, they may prevent Daytona from successfully connecting to the reverse proxy service.

title: Description
description: Running Daytona on WSL2 does not work seamlessly with the Visual Studio Code IDE.

title: Solution
description: While awaiting official support for a "remote SSH path" flag in the Visual Studio Code plugin, the following workaround can address the issue.

title: Docker Extension
description: Daytona provides a Docker Extension for using an embedded version of the Daytona client and server tools directly within Docker Desktop.

title: Create a Workspace
description: Create a new Workspace using the Daytona Docker Extension within the Docker Desktop.

title: Open an Existing Workspace
description: Daytona Docker Extension provides an option to open an existing Workspace in your IDE.

title: Manage a Workspace
description: Daytona Docker Extension provides an option to access and manage your Workspace, providing a detailed overview of the Workspace configuration.

title: Delete a Workspace
description: Daytona Docker Extension provides an option to delete one or more Workspaces, helping you manage your development environments by removing those that are no longer needed.

title: Agent Toolbox
description: The Agent Toolbox enables you to interact with the Workspace programmatically by providing a Workspace Toolbox API to perform various operations within the Workspace environment.

title: File System Operations
description: Daytona provides an option to interact with the Workspace file system programmatically using the Workspace Toolbox API.

title: List Files
description: Daytona provides an option to list files in the Workspace using the `GET` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/files` endpoint.

title: Delete Files
description: Daytona provides an option to delete files in the Workspace using the `DELETE` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/files` endpoint.

title: Create Folder
description: Daytona provides an option to create a new folder in the Workspace using the `POST` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/createfolder` endpoint.

title: Download Files
description: Daytona provides an option to download files from the Workspace using the `GET` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/download` endpoint.

title: Find Files
description: Daytona provides an option to find files in the Workspace using the `GET` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/find` endpoint.

title: Files Information
description: Daytona provides an option to get information about files in the Workspace using the `GET` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/info` endpoint.

title: Move Files
description: Daytona provides an option to move files in the Workspace using the `POST` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/move` endpoint.

title: File Permissions
description: Daytona provides an option to set file permissions in the Workspace using the `POST` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/permissions` endpoint.

title: Replace Files
description: Daytona provides an option to replace files in the Workspace using the `POST` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/replace` endpoint.

title: Search Files
description: Daytona provides an option to search for files in the Workspace using the `GET` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/search` endpoint.

title: Upload Files
description: Daytona provides an option to upload files to the Workspace using the `POST` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/upload` endpoint.

title: Git Operations
description: Daytona provides an option to interact with the Workspace Git repository programmatically using the Workspace Toolbox API.

title: Add Files
description: Daytona provides an option to add files to the Workspace Git repository using the `POST` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/git/add` endpoint.

title: List Branches
description: Daytona provides an option to list branches in the Workspace Git repository using the `GET` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/git/branches` endpoint.

title: Create Branch
description: Daytona provides an option to create a new branch in the Workspace Git repository using the `POST` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/git/createbranch` endpoint.

title: Clone Repository
description: Daytona provides an option to clone a Git repository into the Workspace using the `POST` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/git/clone` endpoint.

title: Commit Changes
description: Daytona provides an option to commit changes to the Workspace Git repository using the `POST` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/git/commit` endpoint.

title: Commit History
description: Daytona provides an option to get the commit history of the Workspace Git repository using the `GET` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/git/history` endpoint.

title: Pull Changes
description: Daytona provides an option to pull changes from the remote Git repository into the Workspace using the `POST` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/git/pull` endpoint.

title: Push Changes
description: Daytona provides an option to push changes from the Workspace Git repository to the remote repository using the `POST` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/git/push` endpoint.

title: Git Status
description: Daytona provides an option to get the status of the Workspace Git repository using the `GET` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/git/status` endpoint.

title: Language Server Protocol (LSP)
description: Daytona provides an option to interact with the Language Server Protocol (LSP) programmatically using the Workspace Toolbox API.

title: LSP Completions
description: Daytona provides an option to get completions for the specified text using the `POST` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/lsp/completions` endpoint.

title: LSP DidClose
description: Daytona provides an option to notify the Language Server that a file has been closed using the `POST` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/lsp/didclose` endpoint.

title: LSP DidOpen
description: Dayjsona provides an option to notify the Language Server that a file has been opened using the `POST` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/lsp/didopen` endpoint.

title: LSP Document Symbols
description: Daytona provides an option to get document symbols for the specified text using the `GET` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/lsp/documentsymbols` endpoint.

title: Start LSP Server
description: Daytona provides an option to start the Language Server using the `POST` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/lsp/start` endpoint.

title: Stop LSP Server
description: Daytona provides an option to stop the Language Server using the `POST` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/lsp/stop` endpoint.

title: Workspace Symbols
description: Daytona provides an option to get Workspace symbols for the specified text using the `GET` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/lsp/workspacesymbols` endpoint.

title: Process Operations
description: Daytona provides an option to interact with the Workspace processes programmatically using the Workspace Toolbox API.

title: Execute Command
description: Daytona provides an option to execute a command in the Workspace using the `POST` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/execute` endpoint.

title: Project Directory
description: Daytona provides an option to interact with the Project directory programmatically using the Workspace Toolbox API.

title: Get Project Directory
description: Daytona provides an option to get the Project directory path using the `GET` HTTP method on the `/workspace/{workspaceId}/{projectId}/toolbox/projectdir` endpoint.

title: Builders
description: Builders are responsible for creating a container image with the necessary tools and configurations for your Project.

title: Automatic
description: Daytona can auto-detect the most appropriate Builder for your Project.

title: Dev Container
description: Development Containers (Dev Containers) provide a consistent and fully featured development environments for your Projects.

title: Custom Image
description: You can build the Project image by specifying a custom base container.

title: None
description: Daytona can build a Project using the default base image.

title: Custom Build Registry
description: You can set a custom build registry for images built by a Daytona Builder.

title: IDEs
description: Daytona provides an option to connect to your Workspace using your default IDE.

title: Set the Default IDE
description: You can set the default IDE used by Daytona.

title: VS Code
description: Daytona provides an option to connect to your Workspace using Visual Studio Code (VSCode) IDE.

title: VS Code Browser
description: Daytona provides an option to connect to your Workspace using Visual Studio Code (VSCode) Browser IDE.

title: VS Code Insiders
description: Daytona provides an option to connect to your Workspace using Visual Studio Code Insiders IDE.

title: VSCodium
description: Daytona provides an option to connect to your Workspace using VSCodium IDE.

description: Daytona provides an option to connect to your Workspace using JetBrains PyCharm Professional IDE.

title: JetBrains RubyMine
description: Daytona provides an option to connect to your Workspace using JetBrains RubyMine IDE.

title: JetBrains WebStorm
description: Daytona provides an option to connect to your Workspace using JetBrains WebStorm IDE.

title: JetBrains Fleet
description: Daytona provides an option to connect to your Workspace using JetBrains Fleet IDE.

title: Jupyter
description: Daytona provides an option to connect to your Workspace using Jupyter IDE.

title: Zed
description: Daytona provides an option to connect to your Workspace using Zed IDE.

title: Cursor
description: Daytona provides an option to connect to your Workspace using Cursor IDE.

title: Headless
description: Daytona provides an option to connect to your [Workspace Toolbox](/docs/usage/workspaces

title: Windsurf
description: Daytona provides an option to connect to your Workspace using Windsurf IDE.

title: Terminal SSH
description: Daytona provides an option to connect to your Workspace through Terminal SSH.

title: Prebuilds
description: Prebuilds are designed to accelerate development by pre-building your Workspace.

title: Use a Prebuild
description: Once you added a Prebuild, it becomes active immediately based on the [project configuration](/docs/usage/projects

title: List Prebuilds
description: Daytona provides an option to list all Prebuilds, providing you with an overview of the properties stored within each Prebuild configuration.

title: Prebuilds Information
description: Daytona provides an option to view detailed information of a Prebuild, providing you with an overview of the properties stored within it.

title: Update Prebuilds
description: Daytona provides an option to update a Prebuild, helping you manage and modify the Prebuild configuration.

title: Delete Prebuilds
description: Daytona provides an option to delete Prebuilds, helping you manage and remove those that are no longer needed.

title: Runners
description: A Runner is a standalone service that can be deployed anywhere.

title: Create a Runner
description: Daytona provides an option to create a new Runner, enabling you to deploy it on a target system and connect it to the Daytona Server.

title: Start / Serve a Runner
description: Daytona provides options to serve a Runner in the foreground or start a Runner as a daemon/background process.

title: Configure a Runner
description: Daytona provides an option to configure a Runner, enabling you to update its configuration settings.

title: Purge a Runner
description: Daytona provides an option to purge a Runner, enabling you to remove it from the Daytona Server.

title: Restart a Runner
description: Daytona provides an option to restart a Runner, enabling you to restart it on the target system.

title: Stop a Runner
description: Daytona provides an option to stop a Runner, enabling you to stop it on the target system.

title: Runner Logs
description: Daytona provides an option to view the logs of a Runner, enabling you to monitor its activities.

title: Samples
description: Samples are quick-start repositories with predefined development configurations, environments, and dependencies used to create Workspaces.

title: Custom Samples
description: Daytona provides an option to use custom Samples to create Workspaces.

title: Sample Repository
description: Custom Sample repository is a Git repository that contains the Sample code and a `devcontainer.

title: Samples Index
description: Samples require a Sample Index (`index.

title: Daytona Samples
description: Daytona provides a collection of default Samples with predefined development configurations, environments, and dependencies.

title: Targets
description: A Target is an isolated processing unit where Workspaces are executed.

title: Create a Target
description: Daytona provides an option to create a Target.

title: Start a Target
description: Daytona provides an option to start a Target.

title: Stop a Target
description: Daytona provides an option to stop a Target.

title: List Targets
description: Daytona provides an option to list all Targets.

title: Restart a Target
description: Daytona provides an option to restart a Target.

title: Delete a Target
description: Daytona provides an option to remove a Target.

title: Targets Information
description: Daytona provides an option to view detailed information about a Target.

title: Set Default Target
description: Daytona provides an option to set a Target as the default Target.

title: SSH into a Target
description: Daytona provides an option to SSH into a Target.

title: Target Logs
description: Daytona provides an option to view logs for a Target.

title: Workspaces
description: Workspaces are isolated development environments containing your project’s codebase, dependencies, packages, and configuration, providing a consistent and reproducible setup for development, testing, and deployment.

title: Create a Workspace
description: Creating a Workspace in Daytona is a straightforward process that ensures you have a dedicated development environment for your projects.

title: From a Git Repository
description: Creating a Workspace from a Git repository sets up a new development environment using a connected Git Provider or a custom Git repository URL.

title: From an Arbitrary Git URL
description: Creating a Workspace from an arbitrary Git URL sets up a new development environment by directly specifying the URL of the remote repository.

title: List Workspaces
description: Daytona provides an option to keep track of your development environments by listing all previously created Workspaces.

title: Open An Existing Workspace
description: Daytona provides an option to open an existing Workspace in your IDE.

title: Delete Workspaces
description: Daytona provides an option to delete one or more Workspaces, helping you manage your development environments by removing those that are no longer needed.

title: Non-Interactively
description: Daytona provides an option to delete one or more existing Workspaces non-interactively, allowing for quick and automated cleanup of your development environments without manual selection.

title: Forward Ports from a Workspace
description: Daytona supports flexible port forwarding, allowing you to access services running in a Workspace locally or via a shareable public URL.

title: Access a Port Locally
description: You can access services running in a Workspace on your local machine.

title: Access a Port via Public URL
description: You can access services running in a Workspace via a generated public URL.
